description: Welcome to ITProTV! The guided tour you are about to participate in has been assembled to introduce you to ITProTV and show you many of the features available as part of ITProTV.
name: Getting Started with ITProTV
subtitle: Introduction to ITProTV

episodes.title: Questions and Answers (Q&A)
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,890 --> 00:00:06,437
[SOUND] In this video, I wanna take

2
00:00:06,437 --> 00:00:12,586
a look at the ITProTV Q and A section.

3
00:00:12,586 --> 00:00:16,070
In an earlier video while we were
talking about the, the live stream,

4
00:00:16,070 --> 00:00:19,788
I showed you guys how there was a chat
box you could use to chat with the host,

5
00:00:19,788 --> 00:00:21,720
live during the show.

6
00:00:21,720 --> 00:00:26,300
But, what if you have a question about
a show that we recorded previously, or

7
00:00:26,300 --> 00:00:29,030
you have a question and it's the middle
of the night and we're not live?

8
00:00:29,030 --> 00:00:30,427
Well, you're not on your own.

9
00:00:30,427 --> 00:00:33,595
We, we don't just abandon you to your own,
own devices, right?

10
00:00:33,595 --> 00:00:36,237
And, and that is one of the problems with
a lot of different study materials that

11
00:00:36,237 --> 00:00:36,758
are out there.

12
00:00:36,758 --> 00:00:40,081
So for example, if you're a book
learner and you just buy a book, and

13
00:00:40,081 --> 00:00:43,350
you read it and you have a question,
there's nobody to ask.

14
00:00:43,350 --> 00:00:45,880
Well at ITProTV,
there's always somebody to ask.

15
00:00:45,880 --> 00:00:50,370
At the top of every one of our pages,
i, it's throughout our entire site,

16
00:00:50,370 --> 00:00:53,180
there will always be a link at the top
of the screen that says Q and A.

17
00:00:53,180 --> 00:00:56,800
And if you hit that,
that takes you to our question and

18
00:00:56,800 --> 00:01:00,450
answer area, which is really
styled like an Internet forum.

19
00:01:00,450 --> 00:01:03,780
When you go to the Q and A,
you'll see a, a basically forum layout,

20
00:01:03,780 --> 00:01:07,670
where everything's divided up by topic,
by certification exam, normally.

21
00:01:07,670 --> 00:01:11,995
So you'll see CCENT, CCNA,
right, those are the Cisco ones.

22
00:01:11,995 --> 00:01:16,700
Here's CompTIA A+, Net+, and so on,
Microsoft Windows 8, Server 2012,

23
00:01:16,700 --> 00:01:19,500
each of the certifications that are there.

24
00:01:19,500 --> 00:01:23,120
And if you have a question, and
you are studying for Network+, right?

25
00:01:23,120 --> 00:01:28,030
You can jump into Network+, post your
question, and we'll get an answer to you.

26
00:01:28,030 --> 00:01:30,590
Now, if it's in the middle of the night,
obviously we're not going to see that.

27
00:01:30,590 --> 00:01:34,100
So, it's usually within the next day that
one of the hosts to log in and respond.

28
00:01:34,100 --> 00:01:38,060
And, and you know we all monitor it,
I do, Ronny, Nate, Mike, all, all the,

29
00:01:38,060 --> 00:01:41,700
all the people that you see up here on
screen, we monitor these forums and

30
00:01:41,700 --> 00:01:44,360
respond, so it's a great way for
you guys to interact with us.

31
00:01:44,360 --> 00:01:47,040
Now, you can send us email also, but

32
00:01:47,040 --> 00:01:50,300
we like this better because it's public,
right.

33
00:01:50,300 --> 00:01:53,540
If you have a question, other people
might have that same question.

34
00:01:53,540 --> 00:01:56,940
Here's a chance for them to see that,
to learn, and to interact.

35
00:01:56,940 --> 00:02:00,770
The other thing is, we get some really
good feedback from the viewers.

36
00:02:00,770 --> 00:02:04,180
There are a lot of creative
people subscribed to ITProTV.

37
00:02:04,180 --> 00:02:07,940
So, I may have one solution,
and a viewer out there may have

38
00:02:07,940 --> 00:02:11,200
another solution that's different,
but just as effective.

39
00:02:11,200 --> 00:02:13,500
And it's really neat to see
those different perspectives,

40
00:02:13,500 --> 00:02:14,700
different points of view.

41
00:02:14,700 --> 00:02:16,320
And so
you'll see that a lot in the forums.

42
00:02:16,320 --> 00:02:18,390
It's really great,
it's a neat way to communicate.

43
00:02:18,390 --> 00:02:22,530
We do have a general forum, that's just
wide open for any kind of discussion,

44
00:02:22,530 --> 00:02:23,750
questions or whatever.

45
00:02:23,750 --> 00:02:27,020
But the majority of them are,
are tailored to the certifications.

46
00:02:27,020 --> 00:02:29,060
So when I go here into the Network+ forum,

47
00:02:29,060 --> 00:02:32,760
I'll actually see questions people
are posting regarding Network+.

48
00:02:32,760 --> 00:02:36,170
You'll see, like, here's somebody
asking about IPV4 addressing and

49
00:02:36,170 --> 00:02:40,090
subnet masks, or physical
connections to a hardware firewall

50
00:02:40,090 --> 00:02:42,050
how many subnets you
can get from a network.

51
00:02:42,050 --> 00:02:45,458
So these are people that had questions
about various things, and it did, didn't,

52
00:02:45,458 --> 00:02:47,042
you know, didn't make sense to them.

53
00:02:47,042 --> 00:02:51,639
Or this one, I, I remember this one I made
a comment about a, a, a network device in

54
00:02:51,639 --> 00:02:54,931
an episode that I had to do something
special to get it to work and

55
00:02:54,931 --> 00:02:57,850
that I,
I broke some networking rules to do it.

56
00:02:57,850 --> 00:03:01,220
And, since it didn't conform to the rules,
I didn't want to cover it in the show.

57
00:03:01,220 --> 00:03:04,070
It's not gonna be on the exam, and it'd
probably be a wrong answer on the exam.

58
00:03:04,070 --> 00:03:07,980
But it was something I'd done in real
life, and so a viewer asked, what was it?

59
00:03:07,980 --> 00:03:09,050
Wha, what was it that you did?

60
00:03:09,050 --> 00:03:10,930
I know you didn't want to do it
in the show, but what was it?

61
00:03:10,930 --> 00:03:14,322
And so so I responded to that and I
explained, you know, what I had to do to,

62
00:03:14,322 --> 00:03:18,350
to get that working, and, and you know,
the, the little work around that I did.

63
00:03:18,350 --> 00:03:21,300
And, you know, if we have to do
special commands or whatever, we'll,

64
00:03:21,300 --> 00:03:23,550
we'll normally put those in the post, too.

65
00:03:23,550 --> 00:03:27,010
So, so, I just kind of explained to
them what it was and, and how we did it.

66
00:03:27,010 --> 00:03:28,960
That's what the Q and A is all about.

67
00:03:28,960 --> 00:03:32,060
If you have questions,
we want to answer them for you, right?

68
00:03:32,060 --> 00:03:36,460
The idea is, by the time you sit down
in that testing booth to take the exam,

69
00:03:36,460 --> 00:03:38,340
we want you going in there
with answers in your head,

70
00:03:38,340 --> 00:03:41,480
not going in there with questions,
so post your questions here.

71
00:03:41,480 --> 00:03:42,520
One of us will answer.

72
00:03:42,520 --> 00:03:44,130
You'll get the information that you need,
right?

73
00:03:44,130 --> 00:03:46,160
That's what this resource is here.

74
00:03:46,160 --> 00:03:50,770
This is available, the, the forums are,
are wide open, so, if you are a free

75
00:03:50,770 --> 00:03:55,520
subscriber or a paid subscriber,
you can read the entire forums, but

76
00:03:55,520 --> 00:03:57,880
to ask a question,
you do need to be a paid subscriber.

77
00:03:57,880 --> 00:03:59,450
So if you're a monthly or
annual subscriber,

78
00:03:59,450 --> 00:04:01,820
you'll be able to post your questions
there, and we'll answer them.

79
00:04:01,820 --> 00:04:03,460
It is a great resource.

80
00:04:03,460 --> 00:04:05,420
It goes overlooked by some,
some customers.

81
00:04:05,420 --> 00:04:08,260
You know we've got a, a lot of viewers
that, that might read the forums,

82
00:04:08,260 --> 00:04:09,370
but not post.

83
00:04:09,370 --> 00:04:11,360
So, we encourage you guys,
post, put questions in there.

84
00:04:11,360 --> 00:04:13,590
That's how we generate content,
generate topics.

85
00:04:13,590 --> 00:04:17,540
And if it's a really good question, we've
had this happen a few times, where I said,

86
00:04:17,540 --> 00:04:19,960
boy, I could answer that but
it would take me forever to type it.

87
00:04:19,960 --> 00:04:22,710
It would be faster for me to just,
to just film an episode.

88
00:04:22,710 --> 00:04:25,290
And so we filmed an episode
answering that question.

89
00:04:25,290 --> 00:04:26,880
I, I love it when that happens.

90
00:04:26,880 --> 00:04:28,410
We wanna make sure you
guys get the answers.

91
00:04:28,410 --> 00:04:31,360
And if it means we need to record another
episode, we have no problem with that.

92
00:04:31,360 --> 00:04:32,070
We'll do it.

93
00:04:32,070 --> 00:04:33,430
We'll make sure you get
the coverage you need.

94
00:04:33,430 --> 00:04:35,060
So take advantage of this resource.

95
00:04:35,060 --> 00:04:35,610
It's there for you.

96
00:04:35,610 --> 00:04:37,540
I, I know I keep saying that,
but it, it's true.

97
00:04:37,540 --> 00:04:40,415
It's part of your subscription,
make use of it.

98
00:04:40,415 --> 00:04:43,469
All right, well we've got a little bit
more to get into, but I'll save that for

99
00:04:43,469 --> 00:04:45,348
the next video, so
stay tuned and I'll be back.

100
00:04:45,348 --> 00:04:51,809
[SOUND]

episodes.title: Membership Levels and Features
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,008 --> 00:00:06,100
[SOUND] In each of the videos
that you just watched,

2
00:00:06,100 --> 00:00:14,236
I highlighted a number of features
that are available on ITProTV.

3
00:00:14,236 --> 00:00:18,185
And with some of them, I had to qualify
whether you got that as part of a free

4
00:00:18,185 --> 00:00:20,225
subscription or a monthly or annual or

5
00:00:20,225 --> 00:00:23,860
how that worked out and
I know that can get a little confusing.

6
00:00:23,860 --> 00:00:27,820
So in this last video I just wanna
highlight our plans and pricing, and, and

7
00:00:27,820 --> 00:00:29,280
kind of show how that works, and

8
00:00:29,280 --> 00:00:31,898
what you get at each level to make sure
you've got a clear picture of that.

9
00:00:31,898 --> 00:00:35,870
At the ITProTV site, you'll see a link
at the top that says Plans and Pricing.

10
00:00:35,870 --> 00:00:38,880
And that's where you can go
to see information about our,

11
00:00:38,880 --> 00:00:40,320
our pricing structure.

12
00:00:40,320 --> 00:00:42,460
We try and be very transparent about this.

13
00:00:42,460 --> 00:00:46,310
There's no hidden charges or
anything like that, this is it, it's open.

14
00:00:46,310 --> 00:00:49,210
You know, one of our goals when
we first started this company

15
00:00:49,210 --> 00:00:51,370
was to be a honest company.

16
00:00:51,370 --> 00:00:53,760
No trickery or
anything like that involved.

17
00:00:53,760 --> 00:00:57,310
So our pricing is very plain,
it's out in the open, and

18
00:00:57,310 --> 00:01:00,030
if you want to cancel,
you can cancel at anytime.

19
00:01:00,030 --> 00:01:01,290
There's no hassle involved.

20
00:01:01,290 --> 00:01:04,650
You can click automated through
our system if you wanna cancel, or

21
00:01:04,650 --> 00:01:06,930
you can send a support ticket, either way.

22
00:01:06,930 --> 00:01:11,320
We, we don't do any hard sales or anything
like that and we wanna be as friendly and

23
00:01:11,320 --> 00:01:13,170
convenient to use as possible.

24
00:01:13,170 --> 00:01:13,700
And, and, you know,

25
00:01:13,700 --> 00:01:16,820
we basically wanna treat you, they way
that we'd wanna be treated ourselves.

26
00:01:16,820 --> 00:01:19,580
So so that,
that's basically what we try and do.

27
00:01:19,580 --> 00:01:20,690
So on the plans and

28
00:01:20,690 --> 00:01:24,460
pricing page you'll see here basically the
breakdown of the three plans that we have.

29
00:01:24,460 --> 00:01:28,560
There is a Basic,
free subscription, that is no cost.

30
00:01:28,560 --> 00:01:32,190
If you choose that you just put in
a username, email address, password and

31
00:01:32,190 --> 00:01:33,080
that's it.

32
00:01:33,080 --> 00:01:34,120
No obligation.

33
00:01:34,120 --> 00:01:35,510
No anything like that.

34
00:01:35,510 --> 00:01:37,870
That will let you watch our live stream.

35
00:01:37,870 --> 00:01:41,910
You can watch the live feed,
you can see the chat You can see the Q and

36
00:01:41,910 --> 00:01:45,070
A, the question and answers library,
you know, or the forms,

37
00:01:45,070 --> 00:01:46,280
you can go in there and see that.

38
00:01:46,280 --> 00:01:47,540
You can watch on the Roku channel.

39
00:01:47,540 --> 00:01:50,180
You can see the live feed
on the Roku channel and

40
00:01:50,180 --> 00:01:53,250
you get access to selected episodes.

41
00:01:53,250 --> 00:01:56,510
We have a collection of episodes that are
attached right here to this guided tour.

42
00:01:56,510 --> 00:01:57,510
that you can watch through.

43
00:01:57,510 --> 00:02:00,920
It's usually one or two episodes from,
from each of the certifications.

44
00:02:00,920 --> 00:02:03,222
So you'll see a collection of,
of free episodes.

45
00:02:03,222 --> 00:02:04,310
All right.

46
00:02:04,310 --> 00:02:08,920
But while you do get access to the live
feed, you don't have the ability to chat.

47
00:02:08,920 --> 00:02:11,140
You can't post a question if you have one.

48
00:02:11,140 --> 00:02:12,448
You can't post to the Q& A.

49
00:02:12,448 --> 00:02:14,030
All right?
So those are things that are reserved for

50
00:02:14,030 --> 00:02:15,470
the paid subscribers.

51
00:02:15,470 --> 00:02:17,230
As well as like V-lab access and things..

52
00:02:17,230 --> 00:02:18,430
We'll see that here in a moment.

53
00:02:18,430 --> 00:02:18,930
All right.

54
00:02:18,930 --> 00:02:20,950
But the free subscription is
still very power, powerful.

55
00:02:20,950 --> 00:02:23,610
You can watch our live feed
to your heart's content and

56
00:02:23,610 --> 00:02:26,460
you can read all the various content
that we make available on the site.

57
00:02:26,460 --> 00:02:29,705
So that's there and it's a,
a pretty useful thing to have.

58
00:02:29,705 --> 00:02:30,680
All right.

59
00:02:30,680 --> 00:02:33,570
Now, if you do become a paid
subscriber with ITProTV,

60
00:02:33,570 --> 00:02:36,000
that's when you get the full
benefit of our service.

61
00:02:36,000 --> 00:02:39,980
That's when you get access to asking
questions live during the show, or

62
00:02:39,980 --> 00:02:41,740
asking questions via the Q&A forum.

63
00:02:41,740 --> 00:02:43,570
Right?
Very powerful to be able to reach out to

64
00:02:43,570 --> 00:02:44,975
the host and, and ask us.

65
00:02:44,975 --> 00:02:45,820
All right.

66
00:02:45,820 --> 00:02:48,720
You also get access to
the Full Course Library.

67
00:02:48,720 --> 00:02:52,690
So every episode that's been filmed
since the day we opened our doors.

68
00:02:52,690 --> 00:02:53,790
I guess that's not entirely true.

69
00:02:53,790 --> 00:02:55,900
We had some early episodes that
were terrible that we deleted.

70
00:02:55,900 --> 00:02:56,839
So you don't get those.

71
00:02:56,839 --> 00:03:00,290
[LAUGH] But all the episodes that
didn't suck, you get access to those.

72
00:03:00,290 --> 00:03:04,630
[LAUGH] And so, so you get access to
the full course library via the webpage,

73
00:03:04,630 --> 00:03:05,490
via the Roku.

74
00:03:05,490 --> 00:03:07,940
You know,
you can access the whole thing there.

75
00:03:07,940 --> 00:03:10,890
You can watch the episodes,
post any questions that you have and

76
00:03:10,890 --> 00:03:12,130
get that information.

77
00:03:12,130 --> 00:03:16,430
You also get access to the, the V-Labs,
the Virtual Labs, the Sandboxes, so

78
00:03:16,430 --> 00:03:18,470
you can practice in those.

79
00:03:18,470 --> 00:03:21,260
And you get access to
the MeasureUp practice exams.

80
00:03:21,260 --> 00:03:25,370
So you can request those keys, practice,
make sure you're ready to take that exam.

81
00:03:25,370 --> 00:03:26,930
So very powerful stuff, and

82
00:03:26,930 --> 00:03:30,291
it's all right there with part of
just a regular monthly subscription.

83
00:03:30,291 --> 00:03:31,650
All right.

84
00:03:31,650 --> 00:03:35,380
If you decide to go to an annual
subscription, if you pay for

85
00:03:35,380 --> 00:03:39,540
a year upfront, we discount it, so you get
12 months for the price of ten months.

86
00:03:39,540 --> 00:03:41,720
Right?
So, there is a discount applied and

87
00:03:41,720 --> 00:03:47,500
on top of that, you get the ability to
download episodes for offline viewing.

88
00:03:47,500 --> 00:03:49,480
And you know, that was a,
a heavily requested feature.

89
00:03:49,480 --> 00:03:51,370
I know I talk about it in another video.

90
00:03:51,370 --> 00:03:52,820
You guys have already seen it,

91
00:03:52,820 --> 00:03:56,140
the guided tour but
that is the big differentiator there.

92
00:03:56,140 --> 00:03:59,580
Going from monthly to annual you
get a discount on your pricing and

93
00:03:59,580 --> 00:04:03,300
you get access to download
the videos as well as the, you know,

94
00:04:03,300 --> 00:04:05,000
the video and audio streams.

95
00:04:05,000 --> 00:04:06,600
I know I didn't talk about those yet.

96
00:04:06,600 --> 00:04:09,456
So, so those are what's
available by going annual.

97
00:04:09,456 --> 00:04:10,620
You know, it is a, a great value.

98
00:04:10,620 --> 00:04:13,810
It's definitely the one that's
gonna save you the most money.

99
00:04:13,810 --> 00:04:17,080
But we know that no everybody is ready
to make a one year commitment and

100
00:04:17,080 --> 00:04:19,050
that's why we have our monthly plans.

101
00:04:19,050 --> 00:04:20,940
The monthly plan you can
cancel whenever you want.

102
00:04:20,940 --> 00:04:24,000
So if you're just focused
on one certification and

103
00:04:24,000 --> 00:04:27,510
you don't need the whole library,
then you just subscribe for a month.

104
00:04:27,510 --> 00:04:30,810
You know, watch all, all the shows that
you need, get the content, pass the exam,

105
00:04:30,810 --> 00:04:31,470
and then cancel.

106
00:04:31,470 --> 00:04:32,760
You know, that, that's fine.

107
00:04:32,760 --> 00:04:34,770
We understand that and
we want to be flexible.

108
00:04:34,770 --> 00:04:36,152
And we want to cater to your needs,

109
00:04:36,152 --> 00:04:38,270
we will match what's gonna be best for
you guys.

110
00:04:38,270 --> 00:04:38,970
All right.

111
00:04:38,970 --> 00:04:41,920
And that's really one of the themes that
I want to carry through this whole thing.

112
00:04:41,920 --> 00:04:44,860
We are always trying to
take care of the customer.

113
00:04:44,860 --> 00:04:47,390
So if there's something that we don't
have, you look at these options and

114
00:04:47,390 --> 00:04:48,480
you're like, well that's great, Don.

115
00:04:48,480 --> 00:04:51,320
But boy, I really wish you had this,
or wish you had that.

116
00:04:51,320 --> 00:04:52,190
Well, you know what?

117
00:04:52,190 --> 00:04:53,470
We want to hear from you.

118
00:04:53,470 --> 00:04:56,050
At the very top of the page
you'll see Contact Us.

119
00:04:56,050 --> 00:04:59,030
I know it's not on top of every page,
it's always in the footer too.

120
00:04:59,030 --> 00:05:00,510
So it's down there, you can find it.

121
00:05:00,510 --> 00:05:04,200
But the Contact Us link, it's up there,
you can click on that and

122
00:05:04,200 --> 00:05:07,400
it'll take you to a forum and you'll
see right here where you can punch in

123
00:05:07,400 --> 00:05:11,680
your name, email address, and a message,
and that'll send in to our support system.

124
00:05:11,680 --> 00:05:13,550
And, and one of us will get back to you.

125
00:05:13,550 --> 00:05:15,100
So that is available.

126
00:05:15,100 --> 00:05:17,390
And you, you're welcome to
email me directly if you want.

127
00:05:17,390 --> 00:05:22,410
I'm don@itpro.tv, we don't, don't hide
our addresses or anything like that.

128
00:05:22,410 --> 00:05:24,360
So you can email me directly,
but I'll be honest with you,

129
00:05:24,360 --> 00:05:27,030
if you go through the support system
you'll get a faster response.

130
00:05:27,030 --> 00:05:28,720
Sometimes I get a little overwhelmed.

131
00:05:28,720 --> 00:05:30,040
But but reach out to us.

132
00:05:30,040 --> 00:05:31,800
Let us know, we love to get feedback.

133
00:05:31,800 --> 00:05:32,700
We love to hear it.

134
00:05:32,700 --> 00:05:35,060
And that's how we find
out new features to add.

135
00:05:35,060 --> 00:05:37,170
The, the V-Labs,
we didn't originally have those.

136
00:05:37,170 --> 00:05:39,960
That's a response to things our,
our viewers were asking for.

137
00:05:39,960 --> 00:05:43,260
The Measure Up Practice Exams, that was a
response to things the viewers asked for.

138
00:05:43,260 --> 00:05:44,800
So just, just let us know.

139
00:05:44,800 --> 00:05:46,710
There are somethings that we can't do,
you know.

140
00:05:46,710 --> 00:05:49,350
Somethings that,
that just aren't possible for us but

141
00:05:49,350 --> 00:05:51,340
whenever it is possible,
we'll make it happen.

142
00:05:51,340 --> 00:05:52,050
We'll do whatever it

143
00:05:52,050 --> 00:05:54,240
takes to make sure that you guys
get the service that you want.

144
00:05:54,240 --> 00:05:56,100
So, so just keep that in mind.

145
00:05:56,100 --> 00:05:57,820
We are very transparent, very open.

146
00:05:57,820 --> 00:05:58,760
We love getting feedback.

147
00:05:58,760 --> 00:06:00,230
So take advantage of that.

148
00:06:00,230 --> 00:06:05,355
You know, it's all here and hopefully,
you become a subscriber, you learn,

149
00:06:05,355 --> 00:06:07,175
you benefit from what we've got.

150
00:06:07,175 --> 00:06:10,825
Over the years as new operating systems
come out, we release more material, and,

151
00:06:10,825 --> 00:06:14,745
and you stay in contact with us, you
stay in touch, and you learn as you go.

152
00:06:14,745 --> 00:06:18,040
You learn your way, your style,
however it is, that's what we want.

153
00:06:18,040 --> 00:06:19,440
We wanna create that friendly environment.

154
00:06:19,440 --> 00:06:22,950
So hopefully that happens and
we have a nice, long relationship.

155
00:06:22,950 --> 00:06:24,890
So keep that in mind again.

156
00:06:24,890 --> 00:06:26,990
Reach out to me and
let me know if you have any questions or

157
00:06:26,990 --> 00:06:29,370
anything like that and
we hope to see you soon.

158
00:06:29,370 --> 00:06:32,550
So, that's about it for our guided tour.

159
00:06:32,550 --> 00:06:35,188
I hope you guys enjoyed it,
and we'll see you live.

160
00:06:35,188 --> 00:06:41,709
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Accessing Show Notes
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:07,570
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:07,570 --> 00:00:10,926
In this segment we're going to take
a look at accessing the show notes for

3
00:00:10,926 --> 00:00:12,230
an episode.

4
00:00:12,230 --> 00:00:15,550
Now, not all episodes on
ITProTV have show notes.

5
00:00:15,550 --> 00:00:19,030
But for a lot of them, the host on
the show will actually take our, our

6
00:00:19,030 --> 00:00:22,560
very own notes that we use, and we'll post
them to make them available for you guys.

7
00:00:22,560 --> 00:00:25,030
You can download them,
and use them for study.

8
00:00:25,030 --> 00:00:28,480
When we write the notes, it kind of
depends on the age of the episode.

9
00:00:28,480 --> 00:00:30,360
If it's a newer episode,

10
00:00:30,360 --> 00:00:34,220
the notes should be embedded right
in the page beneath the video.

11
00:00:34,220 --> 00:00:37,030
If it's an older episode
though the notes might

12
00:00:37,030 --> 00:00:39,760
actually be embedded in a different way,
and that's why we wanted to have this,

13
00:00:39,760 --> 00:00:43,120
this video right here to kind of
show you where to find those notes.

14
00:00:43,120 --> 00:00:44,130
Let me show you what I'm talking about,

15
00:00:44,130 --> 00:00:46,790
it'll make more sense when
you see it on the page.

16
00:00:46,790 --> 00:00:51,580
First off, I browsed the ITProTV sight,
and I jump over to the course library.

17
00:00:51,580 --> 00:00:54,640
Once I'm in the course library, I find
the course that I'm learning about, and so

18
00:00:54,640 --> 00:00:55,968
I'll do A+ today.

19
00:00:57,000 --> 00:01:01,070
And we find the episode whose notes we
want to view, so maybe I want to look at

20
00:01:01,070 --> 00:01:05,890
this storage devices episode,
I'll jump in here to look at this one.

21
00:01:05,890 --> 00:01:09,710
Now if it's one of our newer episodes,
filmed in the last year or so.

22
00:01:09,710 --> 00:01:12,240
The show notes should be
embedded right there on the page.

23
00:01:12,240 --> 00:01:15,710
As I scroll down on the video,
here's the notes.

24
00:01:15,710 --> 00:01:19,240
So when they recorded this episode,
it looks like we got Wes on this one.

25
00:01:19,240 --> 00:01:22,810
When Wes recorded the episode,
he wrote down all this information,

26
00:01:22,810 --> 00:01:24,950
all the hard drive data he talked about,
and so on.

27
00:01:24,950 --> 00:01:28,470
And that's really valuable, because this
is stuff that you've got to memorize,

28
00:01:28,470 --> 00:01:31,390
that you've gotta know for the exam and
to have it just written down, and

29
00:01:31,390 --> 00:01:33,650
already generated for you is really handy.

30
00:01:33,650 --> 00:01:37,790
So, the notes are right there on the
webpage, but if you wanna download them

31
00:01:37,790 --> 00:01:41,840
to save them, there's actually
a little link right up at the top.

32
00:01:41,840 --> 00:01:44,700
It's up by the download link for
the video, and audio feed.

33
00:01:44,700 --> 00:01:48,070
Now if you're an annual subscriber,
you can download the video on audio, but

34
00:01:48,070 --> 00:01:49,990
as an annual, or a monthly subscriber,

35
00:01:49,990 --> 00:01:53,330
you'll have that notes link right
there where you can download them.

36
00:01:53,330 --> 00:01:58,510
And, if you click on that,
it'll take you to a PDF of the notes.

37
00:01:58,510 --> 00:02:02,240
And so here's that PDF, and the same notes
formatted a little bit differently than

38
00:02:02,240 --> 00:02:05,730
what you see in the webpage, but this is
suitable for saving to your hard drive,

39
00:02:05,730 --> 00:02:08,620
you can print it out,
you know make copies of it, whatever.

40
00:02:08,620 --> 00:02:12,132
And now you've got a great
resource there available to study.

41
00:02:12,132 --> 00:02:17,160
All right, if it's a newer episode,
you'll see those embedded right here.

42
00:02:17,160 --> 00:02:20,690
If it's an older episode,
the notes won't be available here

43
00:02:20,690 --> 00:02:23,770
instead they'll just be available
under this link up top.

44
00:02:23,770 --> 00:02:27,610
You'll always see that link up top
regardless of whether it's old or new.

45
00:02:27,610 --> 00:02:29,860
If there's no link whatsoever,

46
00:02:29,860 --> 00:02:32,490
that means that that particular
show didn't have notes.

47
00:02:32,490 --> 00:02:33,960
Some of our episodes are like that.

48
00:02:33,960 --> 00:02:37,520
There's a few episodes where there just
weren't any suitable notes to make, and

49
00:02:37,520 --> 00:02:38,560
that might be the case.

50
00:02:38,560 --> 00:02:41,150
But, you'll find that the majority
of our shows do have notes,

51
00:02:41,150 --> 00:02:43,260
and they're available right there.

52
00:02:43,260 --> 00:02:45,740
If you ever have a question, and something
that wasn't answered in the show,

53
00:02:45,740 --> 00:02:47,770
you can always post
that in the forums too.

54
00:02:47,770 --> 00:02:50,170
That's another great place to look for
notes.

55
00:02:50,170 --> 00:02:52,250
Our show notes will always be here, but

56
00:02:52,250 --> 00:02:55,800
our user questions that we get from our
viewers, those end up in the forum, so

57
00:02:55,800 --> 00:02:58,130
make sure you check out that Q and
A there, too.

58
00:02:58,130 --> 00:03:01,710
Another great place to go,
and find information.

59
00:03:01,710 --> 00:03:03,395
So, if you're looking for the notes.

60
00:03:03,395 --> 00:03:06,733
The place to look is on the video page,
beneath the video, or

61
00:03:06,733 --> 00:03:10,084
right up here in that notes
link that's above each episode.

62
00:03:10,084 --> 00:03:16,319
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Welcome to ITProTV! The guided tour you are about to participate in has been assembled to introduce you to ITProTV and show you many of the features available as part of ITProTV.
